Title: Advanced Specialist, Merchant Sentiment
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Customer Experience and Integrity, one of DoorDash's central operations teams, ensures that when things go wrong in the last mile, there's always someone there to help. Our team creates and administers DoorDash's massive and expanding global network of support centers to provide the greatest customer experiences possible, with the ultimate goal of delivering an exceptional customer experience as efficiently and reliably as possible.
The Merchant Sentiment team meticulously optimizes the Managed Merchant interface across all facets of the DoorDash platform. They handle everything from setting up essential account information like bank routing to fine-tuning store hours and menu photos for heightened visibility. Additionally, they actively participate in quarterly business reviews to measure and enhance Managed Merchant revenue, ensuring comprehensive support and improvement.
At DoorDash, we believe in fostering a culture of meaningful connection, collaboration, and professional growth through in-office interactions. This position requires an in-office presence at the DoorDash corporate office in Tempe and the employee must live within a commutable 50 miles from the office. In-office days are determined by the business and can change based on business needs. Connect with the recruiter to determine what the in-office requirement for this role is. This role will be assigned a schedule that may include evenings, weekends, and holidays. These schedules will be adjusted periodically to meet the needs of our business.
About the Role
We are searching for a Merchant Sentiment Specialist to work with our highest-value/volume Managed Merchants, solving their most pressing challenges and creating opportunities to improve their overall experience as we continue to scale our last-mile logistics platform.
This role will be assigned a schedule that may include evenings, weekends, and holidays. These schedules will be adjusted periodically to meet the needs of our business.
As a Merchant Sentiment Specialist, you will partner with Account Owners (AO) to ensure overall Merchant success on the DoorDash platform through proactive and reactive contacts. This includes but is not limited to weekly syncs with your AO partners and recurring meetings with the Managed Merchants on your assigned roster. 
You will develop long-term relationships with our highest-value/volume Managed Merchants by providing excellent customer service, relationship management, and strategic problem solutions, such as partnering with AOs on suggesting promotions or expanding delivery radius when stores are underperforming and strategies for overall Managed Merchant health on the platform. 
You will serve as the main point of contact for Managed Merchants in your assigned roster in partnership with their internal DoorDash Account Owners. 
You will be analytical, have prior experience delivering efficient execution and communication, and be eager to solve our Managed Merchants most challenging problems. 
This position establishes DoorDashs Managed Merchant support as a standout competitive differentiator in the industry, delivering a dedicated, high-quality, and meticulously detailed support experience explicitly tailored to our Managed Merchants.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Collaborate with Account Owners weekly and troubleshoot support issues for Managed Merchants in your respective roster, including but not limited to payment issues, portal issues, menu updates, and other advanced support issues.
Take inbound contacts from Managed Merchants experiencing real-timenon-live order-relatedissues ranging from account log-in support to changes of ownership and more.
Build relationships with high revenue/volume Managed Merchant partners by being the primary contact and expert for their support operations. Including participation in quarterly business reviews and other regularly occurring meetings to align on overall Merchant health
Promote retention and overall Managed Merchant success through service and proactive outreach via phone, email, or Zoom calls.
Pilot different experiences from time to time to learn how we can invest in our highest value Managed Merchants
Action on machine learning identified triggers accordingly
Prioritize and escalate issues in partnership with internal teams
Develop expertise in how DoorDash's systems and resources work and how to use them to promote positive outcomes for our Managed Merchants
Play a key role in improving Managed Merchant experience 

Were excited about you because...

You have  3+ years of experience in a high-volume support center, customer support, or other high-volume support-related field.
Experience providing advisory and partnership-level support through both proactive and reactive interactions with end users
You are proficient with Salesforce (or other CRM software), and have the ability to view and interpret dashboards/data. 
Proficient with G Suite/ExcelExperience with SQL/Mode is a plus
Experience in a metric-driven support environment
You excel at building cross-functional relationships and determining prioritization.
You're creative and love identifying areas where we can improve the end-user experience. 
High School Diploma or GED required. Bachelors Degree preferred.

Title: Senior Manager, Transportation
Location: Los Angeles, CA; Chicago, IL; Austin, TX; Houston, TX; New York, NY; Atlanta, GA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Drive seeks a Senior Manager to lead fulfillment strategy and site operations for our expanding new verticals.
DoorDash Drive is our company's hyper-growth platform team serving restaurants, grocers and retailers across the United States, Canada and Australia. The Fulfillment team is responsible for driving the strategy, profitability, and operations across each vertical. In this fast-growing, high-energy environment, you'll drive innovation while maintaining a strong focus on quality and efficiency.
About the Role
The Sr. Manager, Transportation and Network Design will lead the strategy, architecture, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics networkshaping how goods move from origin to destination across DoorDashs growing Drive platform. As we scale one of our fastest-growing verticals, youll play a critical role in designing a cost-efficient, reliable, and high-performing transportation infrastructure. Reporting to the Director of Strategy & Operations, this role may be based near a major logistics hub and includes 1020% travel.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Own network performance  Design and optimize transportation flows across first-mile and middle-mile, operations. Develop scalable routing strategies and mode selection frameworks that balance cost, speed, and service-level targets.
Influence cross-functional initiatives  Partner with Product, Engineering, Analytics, Finance, and Fulfillment Operations to deploy transportation technologies (e.g., TMS, route optimization tools) and inform roadmap decisions. Translate operational needs into product requirements that drive efficiency and visibility.
Lead and scale network strategy  Identify capacity constraints, unlock efficiencies, and lead implementation of new lanes, consolidation strategies, or regional nodes.
Drive continuous improvement  Use data to identify cost drivers, service bottlenecks, and opportunities for redesign. Lead pilot programs and process rollouts to enhance reliability and scalability.
Own carrier and mode strategy  Select and manage carrier partners, develop modal strategies (air, ground, LTL, FTL, parcel), and optimize load planning to improve service and reduce transportation cost per order.
Forecast and budget network impact  Align multi-year network strategies with business goals. Build models to project volume growth, simulate future-state flows, and prioritize investments that maximize network ROI.

Were excited about you because...

Youre a systems thinker  You see the full picture of how products, transportation, and operations connectand design accordingly.
Youre data-driven and execution-oriented  You ground your strategy in data, move quickly from analysis to action, and can lead execution across teams.
You thrive in ambiguity  Youre energized by complexity and enjoy building new strategies and models in uncharted territory.
Youve led cross-functional programs  Youve influenced diverse teams and delivered measurable results at scale.
You have 8+ years of relevant experience  Youve worked in logistics, transportation, operations strategy, supply chain consulting, or a fast-paced tech environment. Experience with SQL, Python, network modeling tools, or transportation systems is a strong plus.
Experience in high-growth startups or customer-facing roles is a plus.

The New Verticals team is building the future of local commerce through expanding our product offerings on our marketplace platform. As we continue to scale our Retail business, were looking to hire a Senior Associates to support key strategic growth initiatives and operational improvements that will help drive customer growth and increase merchant selection with high quality, speed and accuracy. In a role like this, you might focus on increasing consumer awareness in-app through merchandising strategies to optimizing key operational quality metrics that impact customer satisfaction like lower cancellation rates & faster delivery times. Title: Senior Associate, Corporate Safety and Security
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Global Safety and Security team is responsible for advancing DoorDash through the protection of people, property, operations, brand and reputation. We manage safety and security risk and deliver value across the business through agility, technology, and a people-first approach. Our team strives to always be in front, and there for our people anytime, anywhere.
About the Role 
DoorDash is looking for an experienced Associate Manager, Corporate Safety and Security to join our Global Safety and Security team. You will work with Global Safety and Security leadership to directly support the safety and security of our New York, Toronto, and Washington DC corporate offices. We are looking for a high-output, strategic contributor to help develop, implement, and execute key Safety and Security programs that align with DoorDashs operational goals and commitment to a safe workplace. This role will be instrumental in enhancing our safety culture, managing events with precision, and ensuring our people are well-informed and supported during emergencies. 
You will partner cross-functionally with Global Safety and Security team members, Human Resources, Real Estate, Communications, and other key business units to develop scalable, resilient, and engaging safety and security programs. 
This role is largely in-office, based in our New York City corporate office location, and will report to the Senior Manager, Corporate Safety and Security. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will... 

Directly influence business development and guide safe and secure operations in a fast-paced, people-first environment. 
Develop and lead workplace safety, security, and emergency management programs, ensuring alignment with local/state/federal regulations and company values. 
Oversee emergency preparedness and response operations, including leading the global Emergency Response Team (ERT), coordinating drills, and ensuring readiness across departments. 
Plan and execute on safety and security logistics for corporate and off-site events, including risk assessments, security coverage, and emergency response protocols. 
Design and implement safety engagement initiatives, such as awareness campaigns, safety weeks, tabletop exercises, and leadership briefings to foster a proactive safety culture. 
Develop and execute internal safety and security communications, ensuring timely and clear messaging for incidents, procedures, and training through collaboration with internal comms teams. 
Lead and supervise assigned Security Specialists and contractors, ensuring high standards of performance, engagement, and accountability. 
Create and maintain program documentation and SOPs, and train stakeholders on safety and security protocols. 
Conduct site assessments, threat and risk analyses, and physical security audits, identifying vulnerabilities and driving mitigation strategies. 
Oversee physical access control, guest management, and credentialing processes, ensuring a secure and welcoming environment. 
Partner with internal stakeholders to analyze incidents and trends, drive data-informed decisions, and continuously improve our safety posture. 
Establish cross-functional working groups to align business goals with security strategies, and recommend risk mitigation plans.
Serve as a safety and security liaison during high-impact events, emergencies, and business continuity activations. 

Were excited about you because you... 

Have 3+ years of experience in corporate safety, security, or emergency management.  Hold a bachelors degree or equivalent experience; safety/security/emergency management certifications are a plus (e.g., CPP, PSP, CEM, OSHA). 
Understand the intersection of physical security, emergency preparedness, and technology in the workplace.  Have demonstrated success in planning and executing security coverage for events and managing ERT programs.

Have strong leadership and coaching abilities with a proven track record of developing high-performing teams.  Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to influence stakeholders and deliver clear, effective messages during crises.

Title: DashMart Team Member - Southgate
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

Title: Associate Manager, New Verticals - Alcohol Strategy & Operations
Location: San Francisco, CA; Los Angeles, CA; New York, NY; Chicago, IL; Washington, DC; Chicago, IL; Minneapolis, MN
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The New Verticals team is all about expanding DoorDash beyond Restaurants, and helping deliver anything our Customers want. Since launching alcohol delivery in 2020, DoorDash has added 30,000+ stores to our platform across most major US markets. As we continue scaling, our focus is on achieving perfect order quality and expanding our offerings to new merchants and products. The Alcohol team (of ~15 people) sits within the broader New Business Verticals organization and owns the end-to-end alcohol business, including growth, fulfillment, logistics, and quality. Join us in our global mission to empower and grow local economies!
About the Role
DoorDashs alcohol business is especially dependent on the success of SMBs (small-to-medium businesses). Were looking for someone to cultivate and lead our growth strategy with SMB merchants. Growth entails expanding SMB selection (onboarding new businesses) and growing same store sales. You will set the vision, track success and partner with our sales team to put that vision in motion. We are looking for a collaborative, analytical, and action-oriented operator who is excited to roll up their sleeves, dig into the data, and solve complex problems to improve the operation and grow the business! You will report into a Manager on the Alcohol Strategy & Operations team. We operate in a hybrid model so we spend a few days a quarter in person together, but all our offices are open should you choose to go in more regularly!
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build & scale. Youll have your fingerprints all over DoorDashs Alcohol business. Youll do whatever it takes to launch, get 1% better every day, and scale something completely new. This means everything from high-level strategy to nitty-gritty operational details.
Strategize. You will help develop the strategy for how we bring the local community directly to our consumers, achieving perfect quality, speed and accuracy every time. You will help create quarterly and annual plans that push our business forward and are aligned with our product capabilities. 
Analyze. Youll assess the operational and financial impacts of your decisions, and iterate based on data.
Experiment. Youll transform strategies into operational experiments that create measurable and actionable outcomes, informing your larger initiative implementation plans.
Collaborate & lead. Youll work with cross-functional teams, including sales, product, and engineering to build this new line of business for DoorDash.

Were excited about you because...

You solve problems from first principles. Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.
Youre equally comfortable operating at 10,000 feet and 1 foot. You dont hesitate to get in the weeds and operate at the lowest level of detail, but youre just as comfortable thinking long-term and inspiring a team. No job is beneath you.
Youre analytical. You let data win arguments, and youre comfortable building complex SQL queries across multiple data sources and have experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools.
Youre unafraid of ambiguity. Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments
Youre customer focused. You are able to identify user pain points, lead with the user front of mind and build go to market strategy to enhance our merchant experience. 
You have 4-6+ years of experience. Youve succeeded in high-performance cultures (whether in tech, operations, strategy, consulting, banking, or a related experience).
You have a completed Bachelors Degree.

Title: DashMart Team Member (Part Time) - Morena
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance

Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties

You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers

Location: New York, NY; San Francisco, CA; Austin, TX; Los Angeles, CA; Seattle, WA; Denver, CO; Chicago, IL; Miami, FL
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Platform team is DoorDashs hyper-growth business segment that aims to revolutionize the first-party digital experiences for Merchants and their Customers. The DoorDash Platform encompasses the full suite of DoorDashs first-party products, including digital ordering, websites & apps, delivery fulfillment, and more. Our Platform empowers Merchants to reach and retain their Customers while maintaining their unique brand identity.
We are helping Restaurants grow their same store sales through all of their owned channels. We do that by building custom Apps and Websites that offer best in class performance. Our teams mission is to enhance our Merchants digital experiences and, in doing so, drive exponential growth for the Platform business.
About the Role
As a Sr. Associate Solutions Architect on the DoorDash Commerce Platform Strategy & Operations (S&O) team, you will play a critical role in driving growth across our various products and services. Reporting to the Solutions Architect leader, you will be a founding member of the Solutions Architect function. 
Your initial focus will be to utilize your growth sense and technical expertise to guide merchants through how the DoorDash Commerce Platform can fit into their business, team and tech infrastructure. Youll do this by becoming an expert in both the DCP offering as well as enterprise restaurant tech stacks, processes, and common challenges. You will play a mix of a role as both a consultant and key contributor to the sales process.
Your scope will also include playing the role of growth consultant and execution partner for enterprise restaurants after they go live on the DoorDash Commerce Platform. Our products are designed to help restaurants exponentially alter their growth trajectory and you will work alongside them to iteratively optimize their same store sales through experimentation, analysis, marketing, and more. Join to help us: 

Scale a new offering that is a pivotal strategic bet for the company 
Help merchants customize and optimize their first-party digital ordering experience
Work on high-visibility initiatives alongside cross-functional leaders in product, engineering, and strategy
Leverage a data-driven approach to guide optimizing both your time and merchant resources  

Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Consult: Build trust with merchants and help guide them through complex decisions to re-envision their tech stack to unlock greater same store sales growth for their first party channels. 
Operate: Dive into the lowest level of detail to ensure successful execution. You will meticulously anticipate and address potential challenges as we rapidly scale. You will work directly with internal and external partners to implement strategies and scale processes while maintaining operational excellence.
Strategize: Develop comprehensive strategies to support and scale the Enterprise Digital Ordering business, considering both immediate and long-term success. You will tailor strategies to leverage DoorDashs technology and maximize impact & growth for our Restaurant partners.
Build & Own: Establish and own the infrastructure needed for massive growth in the business. From there, you will lead 0 to 1 opportunities, creating roadmaps for future growth vectors and owning key outcomes.
Collaborate: Value and build strong partnerships with our merchant partners and across DoorDash, including Product, Engineering, Account Management, Analytics, Finance, and many others. You will work together to bring your strategies to life.
Analyze: Leverage complex datasets and qualitative inputs to generate insights and recommendations. You will use data and experimentation to refine processes and drive measurable improvements for internal and external stakeholders.
Communicate & Advocate: Represent the DoorDash brand with humility and a customer-first mindset. You will navigate ambiguous environments and provide structure for undefined opportunities by creating playbooks and templates. You will precisely communicate your plans to align your team and cross-functional partners with your goals.

Were excited about you because...

You are an eager learner: ecomm, tech and digital spaces are rapidly evolving, but you enjoy learning how to incorporate new technologies into your approach and are ready to self-teach by diving into technical documentation. 
You have digital product experience & strong instincts: youve studied and built world class consumer experiences (ideally in ecommerce).
You have a strong growth sense: you know the difference between signal and noise, how to pull levers to iteratively optimize within a feedback loop. 
Youre a strong communicator: you can interface with senior audiences, internally and externally; you can easily articulate complex details and help audiences quickly understand the so what. 
Youve been told you have a high EQ: you know how to read the room and can quickly build rapport + credibility with XFN partners (esp technical and senior audiences).
You have an extreme sense of ownership: you take full responsibility for your scope of work. You are proactive in solving ambiguous problems and inspire your teammates to excel.
Youre detail-oriented: you have meticulous attention to detail, ensuring no small element is overlooked. Your thoroughness helps you anticipate issues and plan beyond immediate tasks.
Youre even-keeled: you thrive under pressure and maintain a sense of calm when facing challenging and time-sensitive goals.
Youre a builder: you thrive on building from the ground up. You excel at creating structure and process, and youre resourceful in figuring out answers to complex questions with minimal oversight.  Youve used many software tools and are ready to dive into learning how to leverage new ones.
Youre low ego: you want to GSD and are willing to do whatever it takes to make that happen; no responsibility or task is too trivial or too tactical.
You move fast: speed excites you. You prefer to achieve results today rather than waiting for tomorrow.
You can toggle between strategic and tactical: youre equally comfortable with thinking through complex problems and getting into the weeds to execute.
You have relevant experience. You have 3-5+ years of experience in growth, product, solutions architecture, sales engineering, product ops, strategy/biz ops, or technical GTM roles  ideally in a fast-paced environment focused on outcomes.

Title: Senior Manager, Treasury Operations
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Our Accounting team ensures the accuracy and integrity of DoorDashs financial reporting, enabling strategic decision-making across the company. Were on a mission to build a world-class controllership function that supports DoorDashs rapid growth and operational complexity. From driving close process improvements to partnering on key business initiatives, we play a critical role in delivering insights that impact employees, merchants, dashers, and customers alike.
About the Role
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Manager, Treasury Operations to lead and enhance the companys treasury operations. This role will focus on optimizing cash and liquidity management, managing funds flow with Payment Service Providers (PSPs), and improving treasury processes through automation and efficiency initiatives. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in maintaining strong financial controls, ensuring regulatory compliance, and driving operational excellence in treasury functions. You will report into the Chief Accounting Officer on the Accounting team in our Finance organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Treasury Operations Management: Oversee daily treasury operations, including cash positioning, forecasting, and liquidity management to ensure sufficient funding for business needs.
Funds Flow Optimization: Manage end-to-end funds flow processes with PSPs, ensuring efficient movement of funds, minimizing transaction costs, and improving reconciliation processes.
Banking & PSP Relationships: Develop and maintain strong partnerships with banks and PSPs to enhance operational efficiency and secure competitive pricing.
Cash & Liquidity Strategy: Implement strategies for intercompany funding and working capital optimization to improve liquidity utilization.
Risk & Compliance: Monitor and mitigate financial risks related to payments, FX exposure, and counterparty credit risks, ensuring compliance with treasury policies and financial regulations.
Automation & Process Improvement: Drive automation initiatives in treasury operations, leveraging treasury management systems (TMS) and ERP integrations to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner with finance, accounting, legal, and business units to align treasury strategies with corporate objectives.

Were excited about you because...

Bachelors degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field; MBA, CFA or CTP preferred.
7+ years of experience in corporate treasury operations, cash management, or financial services, with a focus on PSPs and banking relationships.
Strong expertise in global payments, cash forecasting, and treasury technology solutions.
Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Proven experience in implementing treasury best practices and process improvements.
Proficiency with treasury management systems (TMS), ERP platforms, and automation tools.
Strong communication skills and ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment.

Title: DashMart Team Member - Roy
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations.

Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!

DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.

Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.

 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties

Superior product and business intuition
Insatiable curiosity for the product and the customer experience

Title: Representative, Marketplace Quality
RoleDescription:
About the team
The Trust and Safety team improves the quality of DoorDash operations through adjudication of background checks and insurance claims, investigation of safety incidents, and implementation of quality measures for users. On-demand food delivery has many advantages; however, there are extremely challenging logistics to ensure DoorDash is delivering the best service to the Customers, Dashers, and Merchants.
Trust and Safety presents a united front to protect the experience of Merchants, Customers and Dashers while solving these logistics challenges. This team's work helps in building internal and external relationships while protecting DoorDash's brand. We work with our internal partners to solve and reduce escalations, monitor daily quality, improve response times, and drive tool usage and efficiencies. At DoorDash we empower our teams to focus on creating an amazing experience for our Merchants, Customers, and Dashers. This is a tremendous opportunity to join a fast-growing team that is hyper-focused on improving the quality of DoorDash's operations.
About the role...
The Marketplace Quality Representative is always looking for ways to help the team become more efficient by streamlining processes and identifying issues and resolutions. You can use logic to make informed decisions that help ensure that our Customers, Dashers, and Merchants have the best experience possible on the DoorDash platform. RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Vendor Operations team, part of Merchant Services, is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations and performance of our offshore vendor partners. These vendors play a critical role in supporting internal teams by delivering high-quality solutions across core process flows, strategic initiatives, merchant outreach, and other special projects. We ensure vendor work meets our quality standards and service level agreements, enabling smooth and scalable operations.
Within Vendor Operations, the New Verticals cohort focuses on onboarding non-restaurant merchants as DoorDash expands into new retail categories. This team partners with a mix of offshore BPOs and SaaS (technical) vendors to fulfill internal requests, contributing to cross-functional OKRs and fueling growth across the org. Given the high reliance on vendor output, we consistently track performance, address quality gaps, and adapt to the fast-changing needs of a scaling business.

As a Project Supervisor within Merchant Services, this role is a key part of the Vendor Operations team supporting our New Verticals workstreams. Youll collaborate cross-functionally with teams like Vendor Audit, Operations, Strategy & Ops, and Product to surface trends, align on calibrations, and communicate updates that impact vendor success.
This role goes beyond executionyoull be expected to make strategic recommendations based on your insights and reporting, advocate for continuous process improvements, and identify opportunities to improve quality, efficiency, and scalability. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, quick on their feet, an excellent communicator, and a natural relationship builder with a knack for solving ambiguous problems in a dynamic environment.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Become a subject matter expert on all New Verticals operations performed by vendors
Act as the primary point of contact for external vendors supporting catalog build, ensuring alignment and smooth execution
Build strong cross-functional relationships and serve as a trusted partner to both internal and external stakeholders
Provide strategic recommendations and identify opportunities for continuous improvement across quality and operations
Lead vendor onboarding tracking, performance deep dives, and maintain accuracy of complex or evolving processes
Drive process and change management initiatives, including updates to documentation and communication to vendors
Oversee and execute pilot projects to test and scale new strategies
Align team performance with OKRs and departmental goals, maintaining a results-driven focus
Support broader org-wide initiatives that contribute to company-wide success
Manage timelines effectively and proactively communicate progress, blockers, and key outcomes to leadership

Were excited about you because you have...

35 years of experience in operations, vendor management, or program managementpreferably in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
Experience working directly with external vendors, including both offshore BPOs and SaaS/technical vendors
A strong understanding of quality management processes, KPIs, and root cause analysis
Exceptional organization and time management skills with a track record of meeting deadlines and managing multiple priorities
Comfort with ambiguity and the ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities or business needs

Clear and confident written and verbal communication skills, including comfort speaking in cross-functional or vendor-facing meetings
A proactive and collaborative approachsomeone who takes ownership and drives projects forward independently
A knack for identifying inefficiencies and recommending process improvements
Familiarity with catalog, content management, or similar operational workflows is a plus

Title: DashMart Team Member - Wynwood
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Top Restaurant Partnerships works with DoorDash partners across the United States to proactively acquire and retain top restaurant selection on our marketplace. Our Business Development team engages with leading small- to medium-sized restaurant operators both in person and virtually to help transition partners from off-platform to on-platform, or from multi-platform to exclusive with DoorDash. Our proposals span multiple business lines, including ads and promos, first-party offerings, and experimental initiatives. We are a dynamic and fast-evolving team, integrating new products and shaping the roadmap for future innovations.
About the Role
Were looking for a Business Development Executive to help us acquire exclusivity with the highest-value restaurant partners in our managed SMB segment. In this role, you will lead strategic negotiations, craft value-based proposals, and foster long-term relationships with merchants that increase their profitability while enhancing DoorDash's marketplace leadership.
Youll collaborate cross-functionally with teams including Account Management, US Local Markets, Local Marketing, Strategic Finance, Product, and Selection to develop scalable solutions and refine our exclusivity go-to-market strategy. Your insights and feedback will directly influence the evolution of our sales playbook and product development.
You're excited about this opportunity because...

Lead strategic negotiations with top-tier restaurant operators to secure exclusive partnerships
Develop and execute thoughtful launch plans to ensure successful transitions to our Account Management team
Collaborate with Product, Strategic Finance, and Marketing to design scalable merchant growth solutions
Leverage internal data and partner P&Ls to clearly articulate business value
Work alongside Account Managers to co-develop proposals grounded in merchant success
Demonstrate mastery of DoorDash's product suite and restaurant profitability drivers
Shape a robust playbook for building complex, high-impact partnerships
Travel to different markets (up to 20%) with flexible scheduling and remote work options

46+ years of experience in B2B sales, business development, or strategic partnerships
A strong record of closing complex, high-value deals from end to end
A consultative sales approach and the ability to align tailored solutions to partner needs
Experience collaborating across cross-functional stakeholders to deliver integrated outcomes
Strong financial and business acumen, including comfort working with P&Ls and ROI analysis
Familiarity with the restaurant or food delivery industry (a plus)
The ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment with shifting priorities
Exceptional communication, presentation, and negotiation skills

Minimum Qualifications

4+ years of experience in sales, partnerships, or business development
Proven track record of exceeding revenue or partnership growth targets
Experience managing the full sales cycle from prospecting to close
Proficiency in analyzing business data and developing financial models

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in restaurant technology, food service, or marketplace platforms
Understanding of restaurant unit economics and delivery service operations
Demonstrated success in strategic deal-making and contract negotiation

RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Marketing Technology team is responsible for delivering best-in-class tools, data, and processes so teams at DoorDash can effectively acquire new customers, drive retention, and grow new business lines across all our audiences, including Consumers, Dashers, and Merchants. Our mission is to ensure teams can deliver personalized, engaging, and relevant content across all our owned and paid channels. We drive the Marketing Technology vision and strategy, partnering closely with Product, Engineering, Data Science, and Analytics teams to translate Marketings technology needs into measurable business outcomes. 
About the Role
Were looking for someone with experience in technical marketing operations or marketing analytics to help manage and improve our marketing technology stack. This role supports our ability to deliver personalized campaigns across owned channels like email, push, SMS, and web, ensuring our platforms are fully integrated, reliable, and easy to use.
In this role, you'll solve complex technical puzzles that directly impact business growth, develop and implement strategies to ensure seamless platform integration, and work closely with our Data Engineering and Analytics teams to unlock new and improved segmentation and personalization capabilities. As the connection point between marketing strategy and technical execution, you'll serve as a key advisor to marketing teams, providing technical guidance to help Marketing teams transform campaign strategy into execution. This position offers a unique blend of technical challenge and business impact, and your work will directly influence customer engagement and business growth.
The role reports to the Senior Manager, Marketing Platforms within our Growth Marketing organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Youll manage day-to-day MarTech platform operations (configuration, permissions, data feeds, integrations) and continually assess how to leverage new features and capabilities across our tools.
Partner with Product, Engineering, Data Science, and Analytics teams to identify opportunities and implement solutions that will improve the customer experience, drive operational efficiency, and support growth initiatives across multiple lines of business.
You enjoy problem-solving in real-time, using your expertise and technical skills to identify creative solutions to data or integration challenges between our 1P and 3P tools.
Work with Lifecycle Marketing Managers and Campaign Operations to build and launch complex customer journeys. Youll help set up targeting rules, event-triggered messages, and multi-step workflows in our marketing automation platform.
Serve as a MarTech expert within the Growth Marketing team, working with Platform Leads to develop, prioritize, and manage Product & Engineering requests. Act as a strategic advisor to senior leadership on topics related to our marketing platforms, providing insights and recommendations to support evolving goals and business needs.
Drive MarTech adoption and best practices: improving internal tools, processes, and safeguards to ensure our customers consistently receive personalized, relevant, and high-quality content from DoorDash.

Were excited about you because...

You have 5+ years of experience in a marketing technology, marketing operations, marketing analyst, or similar role, with a deep understanding of Marketing Technology, Youre familiar with how campaigns are built and delivered across channels (email, push, SMS, etc.) and have seen what it takes behind the scenes to make them successful.
You have extensive experience working with enterprise-level CRM and Marketing Automation Platforms and a strong technical understanding of how those platforms work and integrate with additional internal and third-party tools, including the relevant data concepts (APIs, JSON, ETLs, etc).
You have strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills and hands-on experience working with SQL and BI tools (e.g. Snowflake, Databricks, Sigma, etc). You can write queries to extract and analyze user data (e.g., find all users who took a specific action, or verify how many users qualify for a segment). You can use this ability to support marketing use cases and troubleshoot issues.
You are solutions-oriented, proactive, adaptable, and have a proven track record of managing and delivering technical projects.
You thrive in high-impact, fast-paced, cross-functional environments and consistently drive impactful business outcomes while prioritizing customer experience in decision-making.
You have an outstanding ability to think creatively and enjoy working on complex problems. You can effectively manage risks and devise alternatives when faced with roadblocks.
You excel at navigating ambiguity and collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to deeply understand and solve business challenges, synthesizing complex ideas into actionable recommendations.
You are a strategic negotiator with cross-functional partners and have a proven track record in being able to influence without authority.
You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and are confident in presenting technical concepts clearly and concisely to technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
You have strong interpersonal skills and can work with team members at all business levels across organizational boundaries and matrixed reporting structures.

Optimize and upsell based on performance against advertiser KPIs
Work with partners across DoorDash to align companywide resources to help build-out our partners' digital businesses

Impact Motivated -- You have a natural desire to improve the overall business

RoleDescription:
About the Team 
The Sales Compliance team is responsible for designing and ensuring effective controls across DoorDashs sales organization. The team has 4 functions - Revenue Reconciliation, Contract Operations, Commercial Operations and User access controls. The Sales Compliance team is part of the larger Sales Strategy & Operations team which accelerates productivity and develops go-to-market strategies and processes to support our sales organization. This group builds the engine and foundation for DoorDash to achieve the best selection for our platform and grow revenues across all business lines.  
About the Role 
As a Senior Manager in our Commercial Operations team, you'll be at the forefront of streamlining deal execution, ensuring data integrity, and navigating approvals to maintain compliance and achieve optimal deal structures and pricing. This is a fantastic opportunity to partner closely with the sales organization, providing critical support and enabling strategic opportunities across DoorDash. You'll be a key driver in building a more robust and efficient commercial engine through proactive identification and implementation of system and process enhancements.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will have... 

8+ years in Fast-Paced Tech: Deep experience in high-growth, ideally tech environments, showcasing adaptability and impact in dynamic settings.
Master of Complex Deals & Policy Creation: Proven ability to navigate complex deal structures and create proactive policies that accelerate deal flow.
Process Optimization Expert: Expertise in developing efficient, repeatable deal processes, with a strong focus on identifying and implementing automation and simplification to reduce cycle times.
Influential Communicator: Skilled at communicating effectively and building consensus across teams and with senior leadership.
Strategic Documentation & Policy Definition: Proven ability to clearly define and document key Commercial Operations decisions and policies.
Sales Team Efficiency Advocate: Demonstrated success in expanding Commercial Operations scope to significantly reduce non-selling activities for sales teams.
Deal Execution Leader: A critical enabler of efficient deal formation and execution, with a consistent focus on minimizing sales cycle times.
Cross-Functional Relationship Builder: Proven ability to build strong relationships and collaborate effectively with Legal, Sales Operations, Accounting, Finance, and Product Management.
Team Leadership & Development: Experience managing multi-faceted teams and a strong commitment to their professional growth.

Were excited about you because... 

You have experience leading and scaling commercial operations, deal desk or a sales support function using FTEs, contractors, vendors, etc. 
Self-motivated and able to work under pressure; diligent with deliverables and deadlines, able to multitask
Strong analytical skills along with the ability to demonstrate practical judgment in sophisticated situations
Proactive problem-solver with strong analytical and communication skills, adept at identifying root causes, collaborating with stakeholders on long-term solutions, and clearly articulating rationale for decisions across all organizational levels.
Attention to detail with a strong bias for action to drive sales velocity across systems.
Bachelors degree, Finance, Business, Economics, or other relevant fields preferred
Technical aptitude to work with multiple systems including Salesforce, JIRA, and Contracting Software
Intermediate knowledge of Salesforce, Contracting Tools and Google Suite

Title: Senior Copywriter, Social, Superette
Location: New York, NY; San Francisco, CA; Los Angeles, CA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Superette is DoorDashs In-House Creative Studio. Our team's role is to build and continuously strengthen a unique and meaningful brand that resonates with our customers and connects with culture. We take marketing strategies and turn them into compelling, effective creativity that exceeds expectations at every customer touchpoint. Our focus is on delivering a consistent, unified brand identity across all channels. Ultimately, we craft powerful, emotional stories that drive lasting brand loyalty and preference.
About the Role
Were looking for a Senior Copywriter to help bring our brand voice to life across all social platforms. In this role, youll concept and craft compelling, scroll-stopping copy that cuts through the noise. Youre a natural storyteller whos fluent in the language of the internet, quick to ideate, and collaborative at heart  someone who thrives as a creative partner to channel managers and designers. From high-impact campaign moments to evergreen posts, you know how to make content thats fresh, platform-built, and share-worthy. This is an opportunity to lead with creativity, shape our voice on social, and have some fun doing it.
You will report to Superettes Sr. Creative Lead, Brand Voice within the Marketing organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Write with voice and craft across platforms, from scripts and captions to on-screen text for Instagram, TikTok, X, Facebook, and more.
Be a go-to creative partner for the social team  jumping on cultural moments, trends, campaigns, and key milestones to turn them into engaging copy.
Write across formats, from short-form video to memes, in ways that feel platform-native and audience-first.
Be the writing partner who brings scripts to life alongside our motion designer.
Use real consumer behavior and cultural signals to craft resonant and timely stories.
Be a trusted gut check for community and channel managers to ensure voice and tone is consistent across every interaction.
Translate big campaign ideas into social-first content in collaboration with creatives.
Stay ahead of platform updates and algorithm shifts to make sure content gets the reach and performance it deserves. 
Get hands-on when needed, capturing and editing content yourself or occasionally stepping in front of the camera, if you're game.
Consult with Influencer Marketing, providing a POV on scripts or talking points.

Were excited about you because...

Youve been the voice of a strong brand on social before and know what it takes to develop a voice that stands out online. 
You have a strong creative portfolio of social-first work that has earned recognition both inside and outside of your company. 
You bring a strong track record of crafting ideas and serving them up to audiences in novel, innovative, and engaging formats and styles.
Youre skilled at using social listening to uncover what matters to consumers, and can translate those insights into social-first concepts.
You have proven experience writing for organic social with voice, clarity, and purpose.
You know how to create content that is brand-aligned, platform-optimized, and audience-first, effortlessly shifting tones as needed. 
Youre quick to spot a moment  and even quicker to turn it into a concept that sticks.
Youre a trendsetter, not a follower, and the first to experiment with new features to keep content fresh and relevant.
Youre sharp, nimble, and can deliver great work without a budget or production  sometimes even editing it yourself.
Youre not a traditional copywriter  you have deep, specialized experience in organic social creative.
Youre strategic, insight-driven, digitally sharp, and come to work every day with new ideas for how content can elevate how we show up for our audience.
